work.title: Back-end Developer - Intern
work.description: Here I worked as a Back-end developer (Ruby on Rails). Initially, I felt weird to use the rails framework because I know Python Django framework, it is quite similar and I felt Django is better.  Here I learned how to kick off a project successfully from scratch and also the flow of software engineering concepts applied (finally my college theory concepts are useful!). While I assigned to a project with the senior developer (geeks) and our requirement is to make a centralized portal for wineries for tasting experience. we accomplished this project by this stack Ruby on Rails, GraphQL, MySQL, Docker. Here I explored Ruby on Rails, GraphQL, Docker, CI/CD, Git commands. Finally, I love to work in Ruby on rails framework.

work.title: Fullstack Developer - Intern

I have gained knowledge of how web development works, Even I have experienced with HTML, CSS, Javascript with basic stuff to build a website. Then worked with a senior developer in the replication of Git book website for managing company his own projects version and features upgrade, to wrap-up this project we use Django framework for the backend. At the end, we accomplished the project with all requirements for v1. From this Intern period, I enriched about web development processes and cloud Infrastructure.
